sentences: Nevermore was an American heavy metal band from Seattle, Washington, formed in 1991.
The band has been inactive since 2011, due to personal issues between the band members.
In April 2015, lead singer Warrel Dane confirmed that Nevermore had not disbanded, and there was a possibility for them to continue in the next two years with another album.
However, Dane died in December 2017; this ended hopes of a reunion.

sentences: This album faced much criticism for its production and was re-released in 2005, after being remixed by Andy Sneap.

sentences: Nevermore then toured on Dave Mustaine's Gigantour during the summer of 2005.

sentences: In 2006, they toured with Disturbed and also as direct support to In Flames on the second leg of its North American tour.
section: == History == | === Enemies of Reality and This Godless Endeavor (2003–2007) ===

sentences: 2006 held a bit of bad luck for Nevermore, as bassist Jim Sheppard underwent a procedure for Crohn's disease, which he has suffered from for over 15 years, and guitarist Steve Smyth was diagnosed with chronic kidney disease, and had to get a kidney transplant.
section: == History == | === Enemies of Reality and This Godless Endeavor (2003–2007) ===

sentences: Warrel Dane had previously developed type 2 diabetes, and the band was forced to cancel their show in Grand Rapids, Michigan, on May 13, 2006, due to an unspecified illness afflicting Dane.

sentences: Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018)
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: On April 11, 2011, Nevermore canceled their scheduled North American tour with Symphony X.
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: Later on April 21, 2011, longtime and founding members Jeff Loomis and Van Williams announced their departure from Nevermore, citing personal and musical differences.
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: In addition, on May 3, 2011, it was announced that Nevermore had canceled their entire Australian tour.
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: However, in July 2011, Warrel Dane announced that Nevermore is not dead, and right now his main focus is on Sanctuary.
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: On December 13, 2017, Dane died of a heart attack in São Paulo, Brazil, at the age of 56, putting an end to any possibilities of a Nevermore reunion.
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: Former guitarist Tim Calvert died on April 30, 2018, of complications from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
section: == History == | === Hiatus, possible reunion and deaths (2011–2018) ===

sentences: However, in an interview at Metalmania in 2006, Dane did not explicitly disagree with the many genres the band has been put in over the years, but he stated "I don't think we're power metal."

sentences: Nevermore started in the beginning of the 1990s, when the band Sanctuary was pressured by its recording label to change its musical style, switching from heavy metal to grunge, which was obtaining mainstream success at the time due to bands such as Nirvana and Pearl Jam (both, incidentally, also from Seattle).
